body.name: DeLUX Upgraded Ergonomic Wireless Ergo Split Keyboard with Backlit, 2.4G and Bluetooth, Scissor Switch and Palm Rest for Natural Typing, Compatible with Windows and Mac OS (GM902Pro-Black)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 22 hrs 17 mins
features: [Curved and Split Ergonomic Keyboard Structure for Natural Typing Posture] Human hand-friendly, designed by following natural posture, compared with a traditional keyboard, typing in a comfortable arm angle instead of contracting the arm to awful typing posture, reducing wrists strain and shoulder pain

[Multi Devices Connection] with 2.4G wireless(come with USB receiver) and Bluetooth 5.0 with 2 channels (BT1+BT2), use with up to 3 devices, easy installation and in-fly switching between different devices. And multi-system compatibility, compatible with Win8/10/11/Mac Os/Chrome OS/Android

[2000 mAh Rechargeable Built-in Battery] at a single charge, it can last for 1300 hours with light off (about 6 month based on 8 hours use per day), and with back light on, it can offer 7 days endurance time. The battery compacity indicator located in the top-middle of the keyboard.

[Decent Keyboard Dimension with Scissor Switches and Low-profile Keycap] Reasonable keyboard and mouse distance, was something importance to be considered when comes to select a ergonomic keyboard, if the distance was too long, you have to shift from the typing to clicking in long-distance, discomforts would be felt and in long term use, that would put more strain to you arm and shoulder

[Front and Palm Kickstand, Considering Seated or Standing Posture] There are 4 kickstand set in four corner respectively, just adjust the kickstand and body posture according to working condition, do not be stiff and offer more vitality to your body, not fix in just one typing posture

[Built-in Pillowed Wrist Rest with Skin-friendly Synthetic Leather] Place your hand above it, lift from the ground and support the palm to keep the hand typing at the same level with the keyboard rather than having to bend the palm or paying more effort to keep the palm lifted for comfortable typing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic! Outstanding keyboard!
reviews.reviewText: My old Microsoft ergonomic 4000 1.0v got broken, plus I found that it costs $400 today (5 years ago I bought it for $143). So, I had to look for something cheaper. The DeLUX ergonomic keyboard outshined all others. I am adding picture - it's smaller than the Microsoft keyboard, it's very elegant, quiet, exactly as advertised. I am very happy with purchase. Personally, it was important to me that the keys have backlight. Really recommend to buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars keyboard layout is bit wierd
reviews.reviewText: I am working at home more now, and would like to get back to a ergonomic keyboard. At first this seem good, but there is just something about lacking a dedicated keys for Home, End PgUp and PgDn. Yes, this is not a full size keyboard, but it seemed that I can use keypad for same keys, but I do use keypad a lot. I searched more, and noticed other brands does have identical keyboard, but key layout is slightly different, where as they do have the keys I often use located the same place as the wireless modes (above keypad). I went with that instead, and that other brand of same keyboard had what I needed and at the same time was slightly lower cost. I went with it instead, but this isn't a bad keyboard at all, I just prefer to have keys I can get to. This still a very good ergo keyboard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not working only after a few months
reviews.reviewText: Although product was easy to use and looks nice, it has already stopped working after only a few months. I purchased in July and it has stopped working in November.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helped with my shoulder & wrist pain
reviews.reviewText: I work on a computer all day. I started having pain in my shoulders and my wrist. I had heard of ergonomic key boards and started searching for one. I came across this one and decided to order it. I'm SO glad I did. I have used it for about a month and it helped with my shoulder and wrist pain. I noticed a difference within a week of using it. It wasn't as hard getting used to the keys as I thought it would be. It didn't slow my typing speed very much at all. I love typing on it. It is very quiet when you type. Also, it was super easy to connect and it has worked just fine. I have had no issues with the connection. The keys are backlit with white light, although I turn it off because my cubicle it well lit and there is no sense in keeping it on. I really like this keyboard and would recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Keyboard but Missing One Key
reviews.reviewText: I like this keyboard: good feel, good touch. Comfortable with the split keyboard. But WHY did they not include a CNTRL button on the right? There is one on the left but I need one also on the right. If they had a CNTRL button on the right, it would be a 5 star review. I really miss that right-side CNTRL.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars There is a Mouse Keys KB setting on Macs that can prevent the numeric keypad from working.
reviews.reviewText: This review has been revised after I found resolution to enabling number keys on iMacLove this keyboard. Using it with my iMac 27" 5K but it took a while to get the numbers on the numeric keypad to work.Pros:Ncely weighted for stability, Great visibility at night, perfect for using in your lap on the couch.Feels very solid and well made, much better than a similar Delux keyboard I got a few years ago, Love that it's white. Delux moved the on/off switch to the back of the KB so it doesn't accidently turn on or off when sliding the keyboard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars NumLK doesn't work with new iMac
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this keyboard to replace an old wired ergonomic keyboard I used for my old Mac. I was happy it connected via bluetooth without a problem and most everything worked OK. The keys are definitely a little noisy - this is not as quiet as advertised but I can live with that. The main problem I encountered however, was that the NumLK simply does not work! Pressing it repeatedly makes no difference - the indicator light in the center of the keyboard does not come on. Usually, this would not have been a "big deal", but in this keyboard, which eliminated the stand-alone page up/down and home/end buttons and integrated them into the numbers pad on the side, you must use NumLK in order to use them. So my keyboard basically does not have page up/down or home/end functions (which on Office products are very useful). The manufacturer has no support; Amazon tried providing support but to no avail. They had me return the first keyboard and sent a new replacement. But the problem persists... the NumLK function simply does not work. I will have to return this one too and look for a different keyboard, unfortunately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: THIS KEYBOARD SAVED MY WRISTS! SO HAPPY WITH IT <3
